page.title: 04STAPLETON CHURCH (CONT)
page.content: of the total cost of Â£1,500.The Font. "There appear to have been two earlier fonts,one was found under the pump at the Blacksmith's yard opposite and was a mutilated eight-sided bowl without any ornament."The Bells.There were two bells in 1552 and three in 1752.Two of the latter were recast in 1722 and 1736.The church still had three bells in 1906 but there are now six,two of which were acquired in 1948.Since 1867 the music was supplied by a{harmonium, but in the 1940's the present organ was purchased from Longnor Hall,the property of Major Corbett,thus greatly compressing the space of the vestry. There are approx.60 people who live in Stapleton but only 20 or so attend this fascinating church.
